title: Background estimation in four-lepton analysis
description: I presented the estimation of reducible background in the four-lepton analysis in the ATLAS HZZ workshop.

title: Observation of the new Higgs-like particle in the four-lepton decay channel with the ATLAS detector
description: It describes the observation of a Higgs-like particle in the four-lepton decay channel with the ATLAS detector and presicion measurements of its properties, including the mass of the particle, its coupling to fermions and vector bosons, its spin and parity.

title: 2D workspace for mass and rate measurement
description: I presented the implementation of a two-dimensional fit in the four-lepton analysis used to measure the mass and the production rate of the observed Higgs boson

title: Observation and coupling measurements of the Higgs boson in the four-lepton decay mode
description: The measured Higgs coupling to fermions and vector boson in the four-lepton channel were reported.

title: Observation and measurements of the Higgs boson in the four-lepton decay mode
description: I presented the observation of the Higgs boson and the measurement of its properties in the four-lepton final state.

title: Selected key perspectives of H → ZZ analysis in LHC Run 2
description: LHC was expected to start its second run of proton-proton collisions at an unprecedented center-of-mass energy of 13 TeV in proton-proton collision data. I were representing the four-lepton analysis team to present the highlighted perspectives our analysis want to focus in the coming LHC Run 2.

title: Search for BSM physics including dark matter at ATLAS
description: I presented the search for beyond the Standard Model physics including dark matter in ATLAS.

title: Statistical framework in H→ZZ
description: I presented a general software framework I developed for obtaining statistical interpretations of the four-lepton results.

title: Study of the properties of the Higgs boson and searches for new physics with the Higgs boson at ATLAS using 13 TeV data
description: I presented the latest measurements of the Higgs boson using the 13 TeV data, along with the search for new physics in the unprecedented center-of-mass energy of 13 TeV.

title: Recent results of the Higgs measurements and searches in ATLAS
description: I presented the recent results on the Higgs physics sector, including the measurement of its properties and the search for Higgs boson-like particles in high mass region.

title: Higgs measurements and search for new physics in four-lepton channel
description: This seminar is very similar to the one I gave in Nanjing University. In this seminar, I restricted myself on the four-lepton analysis itself and gave a decent level of details of this analysis.

title: Search for heavy ZZ resonances in the four-lepton and llνν final states with the ATLAS detector
description: I presented the search for heavy ZZ resonances in ATLAS with 13 TeV data. Two excesses were found with four-lepton invariant mass at around 240 GeV and 700 GeV, each with a local significance of 3.4 standard deviations and a global significance of 2.2 standard deviations. More data are needed to confirm or reject the two excesses.

title: Search for heavy ZZ resonances in the four-lepton and llνν final states with the ATLAS detector
type: Talk@Meeting of APS Division of Particle and Field
description: I presented the search for heavy ZZ resonances in ATLAS with 13 TeV data. Two excesses were found with four-lepton invariant mass at around 240 GeV and 700 GeV, each with a local significance of 3.4 standard deviations and a global significance of 2.2 standard deviations. More data are needed to confirm or reject the two excesses.
